intro: Cochlearia praecox, commonly known as the early cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom early in the growing season. The leaves are usually basal and lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
